profile.summary:
Been doing intense business development for diverse business models for 12 years now. My varied experience is validation of my willingness to experiment and learn with each step I take. It also translates into an added advantage as my experience and knowledge helps me anticipate and communicate to audiences better. I look forward to challenges and I work well with people.

My objective is to work in an environment which is conducive to my growth, not only in terms of experience, but also in knowledge. It should also help me explore, diversify, and utilize my potential to the fullest.


N.B. - Please state your purpose when sending the request to connect.

certifications.name: Succeeding in a New Role By Managing Up

volunteer.description:
Out of LinkedIn’s 15,800 employees, I’m part of  a special community of 300 Culture Champions ‒ employees who go beyond their day job to create exceptional experiences that bring our culture to life around our 30+ global offices. ​Culture Champions are responsible for perpetuating LinkedIn's culture and values through events like InDay, and are found across all LinkedIn offices.

​How do we do it? Once a month, LinkedIn gives employees a day to invest in themselves and their communities. We call it INvestment Day, or InDay for short. It’s a day for connection, collaboration and co-creation. InDay is that one day every month which is given back to employees to invest in themselves and their communities.
We are on a mission to empower LinkedIn to represent a global workforce welcoming all cultures, ethnicities and nationalities - embracing diversity everywhere and enabling all to thrive.

This foundation assists various restoration and building projects in Ladakh & Zanskar, India.
 http://csomasroom.org/en/
